heading: exec privilege denied
subheading: clinton cannot invoke executive privilege to limit testimony by two key aides in the monica lewinsky probe, a judge has ruled. the white house could appeal the decision by us district judge norma holloway johnson, but any such move would further delay the investigation into whether the president had sex with the former intern and lied about it. meanwhile, prosecutors have recalled clinton pal vernon jordan for a third round of testimony, and sources told ap that the president's personal secretary, betty currie, will answer questions this week about a possible coverup.
author: wired staff
